channel.title: How the fuck
channel.description:
Ok dont tell me it cant be done because i KNOW it can. ive been around long enough to have seen it done.
1st example: ry60003000
[img]http://www.allgofree.org/blitz/pics/with_hd.jpg[/img]
second: palidino76
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I0PVuJnKaWw]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I0PVuJnKaWw[/url]
How oh how do they do it??? Intergrate their server to 508 and 317???

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @DemonsworldOwner DemonsworldOwner
item.description:
@DemonsworldOwner wrote:

[quote=“mangalover51, post:77, topic:333439”][quote author=DemonsworldOwner link=topic=429844.msg3166931#msg3166931 date=1270092516]
It’s farily simple.
All you do is get the model looks or w/e from a 508 version, and dim them down or w/e to be able to load into a 317, then everything look more hd, it mite be some lag, but u can prolly work around that.
[/quote]

so your calling that simple? you make me laugh >.<[/quote]

It take’s time. . . but its simple, just find all the caches and models of a 508, and convert them down to a 317, until they fit in and it “SHOULD” work. . .

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

its really not that hard. here is what you need to do.

when a incoming connection goes to the server check the client version. then set that session to a specific packet set. http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/concepts/interface.html would be very useful for such a task. hyperion can’t do this on initial download as it does not use a interface for sending packets back to the client, but hyperion COULD be modified to do so easily.

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:55, topic:333439”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=429844.msg3161816#msg3161816 date=1269641130]
Davidi, try actually reading my post that you quoted. I explained the concept of how client-side NPC handling works in a sentence.

“This means that they can randomly walk anywhere within the specified range once the client has received the starting and range coordinates from the server.”

Infact, I think someone told me that they do this on Runescape. I’m not sure how true that is though.
[/quote]I understand perfectly what you meant, I just think that it’s retarded.

If the server does not have the correct coordinates of the NPC (which would be because the client handles the movement) how would the server do thing’s such as projectiles towards NPC’s?[/quote]
I said that the server does have the starting and range coordinates of the NPC. Things like attacking range and projectiles can be handled client-side, even if it does mean sacrificing a tiny bit of security.

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @mangalover51 mangalover51
item.description:
@mangalover51 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:50, topic:333439”][quote author=mangalover51 link=topic=429844.msg3161731#msg3161731 date=1269636338]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=429844.msg3161659#msg3161659 date=1269628303]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=429844.msg3161594#msg3161594 date=1269615909]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=429844.msg3160897#msg3160897 date=1269541101]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=429844.msg3160780#msg3160780 date=1269532967]

Guys look closely… the pictures are different in a small way… there is a guy standing by the steps in the 508 client and there is no guy on the 317… two different servers my friend.
[/quote]They are NPC’s which can be controlled client-side to reduce server load. This means that they can randomly walk anywhere within the specified range once the client has received the starting and range coordinates from the server.
[/quote]Rofl…

No, if you look at the pictures you will see that they are shot from different angles. The NPC’s are in the same place in both pictures, you just can see it from that angle. Check the mini map for conformation.

Thank you for alerting me of the fact that the two pictures are shot from different angles and that this server does not, in fact, use the method of client-side NPC control.

I don’t know why you are laughing at me, this is often done on bigger private servers to reduce load. I agree that I did make a mistake thinking that the NPC’s are in different positions, but I don’t see how that means that this is fake. It just appeared to me as if the NPC’s were in different positions at first glance, and as Cancel ‘confirmed’ this I responded with a justification of why NPC’s would appear in different places.
[/quote]I was laughing because I have never heard of a RSPS that uses the client to have NPC’s walk, because the server would not have the correct NPC coords and several things would mess up.

And I never said that this was fake, because I know that it is real.

EDIT: This is cool, and I might try to put it into the next DavidScape source
[/quote] mine uses npc’s walking they don’t go wrong and they don’t no clip either i use 317…
[/quote]Your client handles the walking by itself? I use 508 and the walking is handled server sided…

Will someone please clear this up? I might just be deluded from working on 508’s for so long, but it seems weird for the NPC walking to be handled in the client even in 317…[/quote] may be handeled in both not for sure…

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck

item.description:

[quote=“cocoa, post:56, topic:333439”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=429844.msg3161891#msg3161891 date=1269647119]

Davidi, try actually reading my post that you quoted. I explained the concept of how client-side NPC handling works in a sentence.

“This means that they can randomly walk anywhere within the specified range once the client has received the starting and range coordinates from the server.”

Infact, I think someone told me that they do this on Runescape. I’m not sure how true that is though.
[/quote]I understand perfectly what you meant, I just think that it’s retarded.

If the server does not have the correct coordinates of the NPC (which would be because the client handles the movement) how would the server do thing’s such as projectiles towards NPC’s?

Because the NPC is still an Entity created by the server >.>[/quote]Yes? And?

Read full topic
